Sentencas: A mathematical model describing the multi-component species transport inside the porous solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode has been developed.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The model includes the water-gas shift reaction in the anode electrode (backing) layer and the spatially resolved electrochemical reaction in the reaction zone layer.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The modified Stefan-Maxwell equations incorporating Knudsen diffusion were used to model multicomponent diffusion inside the porous electrode (backing) and reaction zone layers.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Moreover, the general Butler-Volmer equation was used to model the electrochemical reaction in the reaction zone layer.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The model can predict the distribution of species within the SOFC anode for any reformate gas composition involving carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, hydrogen and water vapour.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The chemical and electrochemical reactions as well as transport processes in the SOFC anode can be simulated, yielding the anode performance under various operating and design conditions.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: This anode model can be coupled with a similarly developed model for the cathode to form an overall model for a single SOFC model.
Titulo: Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode
Multi-component mathematical model of solid oxide fuel cell anode
